1 Corinthians__06.1: Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to be judged before the unjust, and not before the saints?
1 Corinthians__06.2: Know you not that the saints shall judge this world? And if the world shall be judged by you, are you unworthy to judge the smallest matters?
1 Corinthians__06.3: Know you not that we shall judge angels? how much more things of this world?
1 Corinthians__06.4: If therefore you have judgments of things pertaining to this world, set them to judge, who are the most despised in the church.
1 Corinthians__06.5: I speak to your shame. Is it so that there is not among you any one wise man, that is able to judge between his brethren?
1 Corinthians__06.6: But brother goeth to law with brother, and that before unbelievers.
1 Corinthians__06.7: Already indeed there is plainly <u>a fault</u> among you, that you have lawsuits one with another. Why do you not rather take wrong? Why do you not rather suffer yourselves to be defrauded?
1 Corinthians__06.8: But you do wrong and defraud, and that to your brethren.
1 Corinthians__06.9: Know you not that the unjust shall not possess the kingdom of God? Do not err: neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers,
1 Corinthians__06.10: Nor the effeminate, nor liers with mankind, nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor railers, nor extortioners, shall possess the kingdom of God.
1 Corinthians__06.11: And such some of you were; but you are washed, but you are sanctified, but you are justified in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the Spirit of our God.
1 Corinthians__06.12: <u>All things are lawful</u> to me, but all things are not expedient. All things are lawful to me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.
1 Corinthians__06.13: Meat for the belly, and the belly for the meats; but God shall destroy both it and them: but the body is not for fornication, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.
1 Corinthians__06.14: Now God hath both raised up the Lord, and will raise us up also by his power.
1 Corinthians__06.15: Know you not that your bodies are the members of Christ? Shall I then take the members of Christ, and make them the members of an harlot? God forbid.
1 Corinthians__06.16: Or know you not, that he who is joined to a harlot, is made one body? For they shall be, saith he, two in one flesh.
1 Corinthians__06.17: But he who is joined to the Lord, is one spirit.
1 Corinthians__06.18: Fly fornication. Every sin that a man doth, is without the body; but he that committeth fornication, sinneth against his own body.
1 Corinthians__06.19: Or know you not, that your members are the temple of the Holy Ghost, who is in you, whom you have from God; and you are not your own?
1 Corinthians__06.20: For you are bought with a great price. Glorify and bear God in your body.
